intro: Agapetes serpens var. stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved silverleaf, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the Andes Mountains of South America, where it thrives in cool, humid environments. The plant is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped white flowers. It is often found in cloud forests at high elevations, where it contributes to the local biodiversity. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
